item.title: Apple Fritter Waffle Donuts: Balancing Texture, Leavening, and Apple Structure
item.description: A guide to making crispy-on-the-outside, fluffy apple fritter waffle donuts using a standard waffle maker. Learn the specific reasons overmixing creates dense donuts, how apple size affects final texture, why waffle maker temperature variation matters, and techniques for achieving a stable glaze that sets without running. This recipe balances tart Granny Smith apples with warm spices and emerges from the waffle maker in about 30 minutes total.
